intro: Reholttumia remotipinna, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a low-growing perennial herb with succulent, fleshy stems that help it retain moisture in harsh environments. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring, typically in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are narrow and linear, adapted to reduce water loss through transpiration. Reholttumia remotipinna is often found in sandy or gravelly soils, thriving in areas with minimal rainfall.
